abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Credit
            Project, will support the Government of the Republic of
            Montenegro, in the implementation of a structural reform
            agenda, to enhance medium-term fiscal sustainability, and
            improve the prospects for economic growth, as a basis for
            sustained poverty reduction. The project will support
            specific reforms in the areas of pubic expenditure
            management, pensions, the energy sector, labor markets, and
            the business environment. While the project will enhance
            recent stabilization gains, by supporting up front actions
            to tackle major fiscal imbalances, and sectoral reforms, to
            enhance medium-term fiscal sustainability, and finance
            budgetary gaps to prod external reserves, risks include
            political issues regarding the proceeding points for a new
            union between Serbia and Montenegro, since the precise
            development of implementation arrangements will require
            agreement on critical details, including on the financing of
            the new union structure, and on harmonizing external trade
            policies, which may prove more difficult than originally
            envisaged. Moreover, the challenge of mitigating the
            short-term social impacts of reforms in the face of public
            expectations of rising living standards, could create
            pressures to raise government expenditures above budgeted
            levels. Also, the limited institutional capacity may hinder
            the pace of reform, and, economic recovery could be affected
            by delays in the disbursement of pledged donor assistance,
            and in concluding a concessional debt restructuring
            arrangement with the London Club.
